why: Understanding movement optimism helps you move with confidence, not fear of 'wrong' positions.

slides.title: Movement Optimism
slides.content: Your body has a remarkable ability to adapt to various positions and stresses. Embracing diverse movements enhances resilience and reduces injury risk.

slides.title: Beyond Biomechanics
slides.content: While biomechanics matter, they don't solely dictate pain or injury. Individual variability and adaptability are just as important as 'correct' form.

slides.title: Individualized Approach
slides.content: Tailoring exercises to your interests and goals improves outcomes. Engaging in enjoyable activities promotes adherence and overall well-being.

slides.title: Movement Ecosystem
slides.content: Pain and function are influenced by biological, psychological, and social factors. A holistic approach considers all aspects of your life and environment.

slides.title: Myth vs Fact
slides.content: Myth: There's one 'correct' way to move. Fact: Your body adapts to different movement patterns safely.

slides.title: Try this today
slides.content: Choose one exercise you enjoy doing. Focus on what feels good, not what looks 'perfect.' Trust your body's adaptability.
slides.resourceLabel: Listen: Building a Healthy Movement Ecosystem
